title: Q+A: Brett Eldredge talks being No. 1, Taylor Swift, Darius Rucker and Miss America
text:
Friday, Oct. 2, 2015 | 2 a.m. Courtesy Country singer-songwriter Brett Eldredge. Eric Jamison / Invision / AP Brett Eldredge arrives at the 2015 Billboard Music Awards on Sunday, May 17, 2015, in MGM Grand Garden Arena. Getty Images Brett Eldredge attends Day 2 of the 2014 ACM Party for a Cause at the Linq on Saturday, April 5, 2014, in Las Vegas. ACM/Getty Images Jake Owen, Scotty McCreery, Brett Eldredge, Charles Kelley and Darius Rucker take part in the 2013 ACM Lifting Lives Celebrity Golf Classic hosted by Rucker on Saturday, March 6, 2013, at TPC Summerlin. 
The career of country singer-songwriter Brett Eldredge, who is in town Sunday for the 2015 Route 91 Harvest Country Music Fest, is on a roll. 
Eldredge, 29, is the reigning County Music Association New Artist of the Year; his last three singles, “Don’t Ya,” “Beat of the Music” and “Mean to Me,” all hit No. 1, and his latest, “Lose My Mind,” is on its way to the top; and his new album, “Illinois,” released Sept. 11, debuted at No. 1 on the U.S. Country chart. 
He also recently judged the Miss America Pageant in Atlantic City. “That was a dream come true! I had no idea what I was getting into, and I’m glad that I did it,” he said, laughing. 
Eldredge, whose gratefulness for his success is apparent, answered questions over the phone Sept. 23: 
Are you excited about Las Vegas? 
I’m really pumped! I’ve been looking forward to Route 91 Harvest for a long time. It will re-electrify me. 
What can fans expect in your set at Route 91 Harvest on Oct. 4? 
I like my shows to be like a conversation in my living room. They’re relaxed and an escape from the outside world — a rollercoaster ride of emotions, laugh, cry, a lot of emotions. 
Will you be around to check out the first two days? 
I wish! I’ll only be there the day of the show. I’ll make the most of it, though (laughs). 
Do you prefer indoor or outdoor concerts? 
It doesn’t really matter to me. Each one has something different to offer. I’m looking forward to the good weather in Las Vegas and sweating onstage. It lets the crowd know that I’m working. I sweat indoors, too! 
I love to perform, so I’ll hit up any stage. 
How did your life and career change after winning the CMA New Artist of the Year award last year? 
It escalated everything for me in a big way. It launched my career into another level. I’ve been blown away by what’s happened since. I just celebrated my first No. 1 country album. 
The award gave a big boost to my career that I really needed. It’s a big award to win, and I’m very thankful. 
What was it like touring with Taylor Swift and Darius Rucker? 
The tours were completely different, but they are both amazing people. Taylor is an incredible person, and she’s the biggest star in the world. I learned a lot from her. It was good to keep my eyes and ears open and go along for the ride. 
Darius is such a down to earth guy. He’s someone you’d want to hang out with all the time. He goes out of his way to make you feel comfortable, and you can’t not like him and his voice. I hung out with him all the time on tour. 
What are you working on right now? You’re going on a headlining tour with Thomas Rhett, correct? 
We kick off Oct. 29 in New York City. We’ve always talked about doing a show together. We like hanging out, so we’re doing a co-headliner tour. I’m really excited about it. It will have a whole new energy and concept. 
Do you prefer writing, producing or performing? 
I love to see the whole process — write the song, record it, take the recording to radio, release an album, then sing it for everybody. I put my heart and soul into the entire process, and it’s amazing when it all comes together. 
Who are your music inspirations, and who are you listening to right now? 
I am a big Frank Sinatra fan. He will be my No. 1 idol forever and always. I also love Ray Charles, Brooks and Dunn, John Mayer. I grew up listening to The Eagles. The great thing about music is that there is so much accessibility to everything. 
Tell me about your experience judging the Miss America Pageant a few weeks ago in Atlantic City. 
(Laughs) That was a dream come true! I had no idea what I was getting into, and I’m glad that I did it. It it’s a big deal to these girls. They spend their whole life to compete, and they get one shot. 
I tried to do my best job judging, and I’m thankful that I got to do it. It was a lot of points with my guy friends, too (laughs). 
Do you have a favorite song that you especially enjoy performing? 
“Beat of the Music.” It’s a fun song to sing live. It was the most-played song last year on country radio. The crowd sings it out loud. It’s a special moment. 
You went skydiving and shark diving to celebrate your first two of three consecutive No. 1 songs. Have you commemorated the third? 
I haven’t yet. I’m thinking about a Dinner in the Sky experience and have been looking around for that. 
What do you like to do for fun in Las Vegas? 
I’m a pool guy. I like to hit up the pools, the bar at the pools and hang out and relax. I like the clubs and to gamble. There’s nothing better than the pools to drink, sit there and relax and enjoy the Las Vegas heat. 
The 2015 Route 91 Harvest Country Music Fest is at MGM Resorts Village across from the Luxor from Friday through Sunday. Brett Eldredge performs Sunday. An interview with Joe Nichols was posted Thursday, and a talk with Jake Owen will be posted Saturday.
